meanings: a fact or situation that is observed to exist or happen, especially one whose cause or explanation is in question

common: The Northern Lights are a beautiful natural phenomenon.
Social media is a relatively recent phenomenon that has changed how we communicate.
fun: The sudden craving for pickles and ice cream was a mysterious phenomenon her pregnancy explained.
In our office, the phenomenon of the disappearing coffee creamer remains unsolved.

meanings: (of a person) not identified by name; of unknown name
having no outstanding, individual, or unusual features; unremarkable or impersonal

common: The donation was made by an anonymous benefactor.
She works for an anonymous government agency.
fun: He posted his poetry online anonymously, terrified his friends would discover his secret romantic side.
The building was an anonymous glass box, indistinguishable from a hundred others in the financial district.

meanings: the art or practice of taking and processing photographs
the process or job of taking photographs

common: She studied photography at art school.
Advances in digital photography have made it accessible to everyone.
fun: His photography of street cats turned into a surprisingly popular Instagram account.
Time-lapse photography revealed the secret, graceful dance of the blooming flower.

meanings: (of a situation) free from financial worry

common: This is the most comfortable chair I've ever sat in.
After a few meetings, she felt comfortable speaking up in the group.
fun: The cat found the most comfortable spot in the house: a sunbeam directly on the keyboard.
He was comfortable enough with his cooking skills to attempt a soufflé for the first time.

meanings: the degree or intensity of heat present in a substance or object
a body temperature above the normal; fever

common: The temperature dropped sharply overnight.
The nurse took the patient's temperature.
fun: The temperature of the debate rose with every accusation thrown across the room.
He could judge the oven's temperature just by the smell of the roasting chicken.

meanings: required to be done, achieved, or present; needed; essential
determined, existing, or happening by natural laws or predestination; inevitable

common: A good diet is necessary for maintaining health.
It is necessary to fill out the application form completely.
fun: For a wizard, a pointy hat is not just fashionable but absolutely necessary.
The cat deemed it necessary to knock the pen off the desk every five minutes.

meanings: the scientific study of the human mind and its functions, especially those affecting behavior
the mental characteristics or attitude of a person or group

common: She decided to major in psychology to understand human behavior better.
The marketing campaign used principles of consumer psychology.
fun: Understanding the psychology of a squirrel hoarding nuts could explain my uncle's coupon collection.
The game designer applied reverse psychology by making the hardest level the most attractive.

meanings: a lung inflammation caused by bacterial or viral infection, in which the air sacs fill with pus and may become solid

common: The elderly patient was hospitalized with a severe case of pneumonia.
Vaccines can help prevent certain types of pneumonia.
fun: The pirate captain blamed his weak singing voice on a past bout of 'sea-faring pneumonia'.
My phone caught a digital pneumonia after downloading that suspicious file.

meanings: （传说中守护地下财宝的）地精，侏儒
a legendary dwarfish creature supposed to guard the earth's treasures underground
a short, pithy statement expressing a general truth; a maxim

common: The garden was decorated with a small statue of a gnome.
He collected ancient books filled with philosophical gnomes.
fun: The garden gnome claimed the best spot for sunbathing, right next to the petunias.
Her life's motto was a simple gnome: 'Never trust a squirrel with your snacks.'

meanings: the quality or state of being physically strong
the capacity of an object or substance to withstand great force or pressure
a good or beneficial quality or attribute of a person or thing

common: He lifted the heavy box with impressive strength.
The strength of the bridge was tested by engineers.
fun: Her greatest strength was the ability to find the remote control in under ten seconds.
The strength of his argument was rivaled only by the weakness of his evidence.

meanings: the measurement of something from end to end
the amount of time something lasts
the extent of a piece of writing or a film

common: The length of the swimming pool is 25 meters.
We discussed the issue at great length during the meeting.
fun: My dog, in a moment of pure optimism, tried to measure the length of the sofa with his entire body.
The length of the movie was directly proportional to the number of times I checked my phone.

meanings: the measurement or extent of something from side to side

common: The width of the new door is 90 centimeters.
Please measure the length and width of the room.
fun: The width of his smile when he saw the cake was almost as wide as the cake itself.
Trying to park in that narrow spot felt like a high-stakes exam on the precise width of my car.

meanings: scattered fragments, typically of something wrecked or destroyed
loose natural material consisting especially of broken pieces of rock

common: After the earthquake, rescue workers searched through the debris for survivors.
The storm left a trail of debris all over the streets.
fun: My desk is currently an archaeological site, with layers of coffee cups, paper debris, and forgotten pens.
The toddler's lunchtime often looked like a tiny explosion, with food debris covering every surface within a two-meter radius.

meanings: （文学、艺术、电影、音乐等的）类型，体裁
a category of artistic composition, as in music or literature, characterized by similarities in form, style, or subject matter
a style, especially in the arts, that involves a particular set of characteristics

common: Science fiction is my favorite literary genre.
The film festival featured movies from a wide variety of genres.
fun: His cooking defies genre; it's a fusion of chaos, bold flavors, and questionable plating.
My music playlist is a genre-hopping time machine, jumping from 80s synth-pop to medieval lute music in three songs.

meanings: the second month of the year, in the Gregorian calendar

common: My birthday is in February.
February is the shortest month of the year.
fun: February is the month where my New Year's resolutions go to quietly hibernate, forgotten under a blanket of cold weather.
Spelling 'February' correctly without autocorrect feels like a minor personal victory every single time.

meanings: a building or room containing collections of books, periodicals, and sometimes films and recorded music for use or borrowing
a collection of books and periodicals held in a library
a series of books or recordings issued by a company as a set

common: I spent the afternoon studying in the quiet library.
You can borrow that novel from the public library.
fun: My personal library is so vast, it has its own gravitational pull.
The squirrel's nest was a curious library of acorns and shiny bottle caps.

meanings: a device for recording visual images in the form of photographs, film, or video signals

common: She brought her camera to capture the beautiful sunset.
Security cameras are installed throughout the building for safety.
fun: The chameleon is nature's stealth camera, blending in before snapping up its prey.
My memory is a faulty camera that only develops blurry pictures of where I left my keys.

meanings: a weapon with a long metal blade and a hilt with a hand guard, used for thrusting or striking

common: The knight drew his sword to defend the castle.
In the museum, we saw an ancient sword from the Roman era.
fun: His wit was sharper than a double-edged sword, leaving his opponents speechless.
The chef wielded his kitchen knife with the precision of a master's sword.

meanings: a piece of land surrounded by water
a thing resembling an island, especially in being isolated, detached, or surrounded in some way

common: They went on vacation to a tropical island in the Pacific.
The kitchen island provides extra counter space and storage.
fun: In the sea of chatter, her quiet confidence was an island of calm.
My desk is a chaotic island surrounded by a ocean of carpet.

meanings: a feeling of uncertainty or lack of conviction
question the truth or fact of

common: There is no doubt that he is the most qualified candidate for the job.
I doubt we will arrive on time if we don't leave now.
fun: His promise was so flimsy, doubt blew through it like a hurricane.
I have a tiny, nagging doubt that my cat understands English but chooses to ignore me.
